title: Trump Escalates Tariff Threats, Showing Little Interest in New Trade Deals
summary: The president’s supporters portray him as a top dealmaker. But, at least for now, far more trading partners have gotten stiff tariffs than trade deals.

title: How Luggage Maker Eagle Creek Has Survived Trump’s Trade War. So Far.
summary: Eagle Creek’s experience underscores how President Trump’s chaotic approach to tariffs is having a real impact, even before the toughest levies take effect.

title: Trump Tariff Letters: See the Latest Rates and Countries Affected
summary: President Trump has told more than two dozen countries that they will face tariffs of at least 20 percent on Aug. 1 if they don’t reach agreements by then.

title: After Texas Floods, Summer Camps Reassess Safety Measures Amid Parental Concerns
summary: Camp officials across the country said they had heard from worried parents after the Texas floods. As they try to reassure them, some camps are adding more safety procedures.

title: After Texas Disaster, Trump Shifts His Tone on FEMA
summary: Earlier this year, President Trump suggested he wanted to shutter the agency. Now, he says his aides “fixed it up in no time.”

title: An Army of Searchers Combs the Banks of the Guadalupe for the Missing
summary: Volunteers and professionals from around the country and Mexico are still searching the challenging terrain for victims of the Texas flood.

title: What to Know About the Central Texas Floods: Death Toll, Map and More
summary: At least 129 people, including three dozen children, died in the torrential downpour. Many remain missing in the hardest-hit county.

title: Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Ban Faces New Peril: Class Actions
summary: In last month’s decision limiting one judicial tool, universal injunctions, the court seemed to invite lower courts to use class actions as an alternative.

title: ICE Set to Vastly Expand Its Reach With New Funds
summary: After the passage of President Trump’s domestic policy law, the Department of Homeland Security is poised to hire thousands of new immigration agents and double detention space.

title: ICE Raids Scare Off L.A. Workers Rebuilding Fire-Torn Areas
summary: Immigrant workers are central to recovery efforts in neighborhoods burned in the January wildfires, but recent raids have led some to stay home.

title: UnitedHealth’s Campaign to Quiet Critics
summary: The company has invoked the murder of an executive last year to complain about coverage in news outlets, on streaming services and on social media.

title: Our Investigation of UnitedHealth Started With a Tip
summary: A reporter was familiar with the insurance giant under scrutiny and the law firm known for its attack stance. Then one hired the other.

title: How ‘Superman’ Star David Corenswet Won the Role
summary: The actor has a man-out-of-time quality that makes him surprisingly like his character. But he is hyperaware of the present expectations riding on his performance.

title: Can ‘Superman’ Fly Above Today’s Polarized Politics?
summary: The director of the reboot, James Gunn, called the superhero from the planet Krypton “an immigrant,” thrusting the summer popcorn movie into an Earthbound culture war.

title: Texas Court Seals Records in Ken Paxton’s Divorce Case
summary: The order meant details in the case, which involves allegations of adultery, would not be public as the Texas attorney general challenges Senator John Cornyn in the 2026 primary.

title: It’s YouTube v. Netflix as the Streaming Wars Come Down to 2
summary: The two giant video companies have far different strategies, but the same goal: controlling your TV set.

title: Spend an Hour in the Dark With Bats, Cats and Naked Mole Rats
summary: The Bronx Zoo has reopened its World of Darkness exhibit after a 16-year hiatus.

title: Air India Plane Crash Report Says Fuel to Engines Was Cut Off
summary: A focus on the Boeing 787’s fuel switches in a preliminary assessment raised questions about the pilots’ actions, but much is still unknown about Flight 171.

title: Timeline Details Final Seconds of Crashed Air India Flight
summary: Investigators released a preliminary account of the crash, describing how the plane struggled after its fuel supply was cut.

title: Trump’s Cabinet of Incompetents
summary: Putting talking heads in charge — not the best idea.

title: Two Palestinians Are Killed in a West Bank Clash With Israeli Settlers
summary: Palestinian authorities and family members said Israeli settlers beat and killed a Palestinian-American man. Israel said the violence began when Palestinians threw stones at Israeli civilians.

title: Grok Chatbot Mirrored X Users’ ‘Extremist Views’ in Antisemitic Posts, xAI Says
summary: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence company said its Grok chatbot had also undergone a code update that caused it to share antisemitic messages this week.

title: Bill Dilworth, Caretaker of ‘The New York Earth Room,’ Is Dead at 70
summary: For decades, he tended a SoHo loft filled with dirt, made by the conceptual artist Walter De Maria. People made pilgrimages to see it — and Mr. Dilworth, its magnetic steward.

title: You Saved and Saved for Retirement. Now You Need a Plan to Cash Out.
summary: Most people enter retirement without any idea how to manage withdrawing their savings without running out of money. Here is what you need to know.
